009
010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Inversion;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class represents an arbitrary linear transformation in 2D. Instances of
022 * this class and any subclass are immutable. See Secs. 21.1 and 21.3 of [1] for
023 * details.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
027 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 */
030public class LinearMapping2D implements Mapping2D, Inversion {
031        
032        protected final double 
033                a00, a01, a02,
034                a10, a11, a12,
035                a20, a21, a22;
036
037        //  constructors -----------------------------------------------------
038        
039        /**
040         * Creates a new identity mapping.
041         */
042        public LinearMapping2D() {
043                a00 = 1; a01 = 0; a02 = 0;
044                a10 = 0; a11 = 1; a12 = 0;
045                a20 = 0; a21 = 0; a22 = 1;
046        }
047        
048        /**
049         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix
050         * of arbitrary size (may be even empty). The actual transformation 
051         * matrix is formed by inserting the given matrix into
052         * a 3x3 identity matrix starting at position (0,0).
053         * 
054         * @param A a matrix of arbitrary size
055         */
056        public LinearMapping2D(double[][] A) {
057                double[][] M = extract3x3Matrix(A);
058                a00 = M[0][0]; a01 = M[0][1]; a02 = M[0][2];
059                a10 = M[1][0]; a11 = M[1][1]; a12 = M[1][2];
060                a20 = M[2][0]; a21 = M[2][1]; a22 = M[2][2];
061        }
062        
063        /**
064         * Inserts the given matrix into a new 3x3 identity matrix,
065         * starting at element (0,0). All elements outside
066         * 3x3 are ignored. 
067         * 
068         * @param A the original matrix
069         * @return a 3x3 matrix
070         */
071        private static double[][] extract3x3Matrix(double[][] A) {
072                double[][] M = Matrix.idMatrix(3);
073                final int m = Math.min(3, A.length);    // max. 3 rows
074                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
075                        final int n = Math.min(3, A[i].length); // max. 3 columns
076                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
077                                M[i][j] = A[i][j];
078                        }
079                }
080                return M;
081        }
082
083        /**
084         * Creates an arbitrary linear mapping from the specified matrix elements.
085         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
086         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
087         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
088         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
089         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
090         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
091         * @param a20 matrix element A_20
092         * @param a21 matrix element A_21
093         * @param a22 matrix element A_22
094         */
095        public LinearMapping2D (
096                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
097                        double a10, double a11, double a12,
098                        double a20, double a21, double a22) {
099                this.a00 = a00;  this.a01 = a01;  this.a02 = a02;
100                this.a10 = a10;  this.a11 = a11;  this.a12 = a12;
101                this.a20 = a20;  this.a21 = a21;  this.a22 = a22;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Creates a new linear mapping from an existing linear mapping.
106         * @param lm a given linear mapping
107         */
108        public LinearMapping2D (LinearMapping2D lm) {
109                this(lm.getTransformationMatrix());
110        }
111        
112        // ----------------------------------------------------------
113        
114        /**
115         * Scales the transformation matrix such that a22 becomes 1.
116         * Any linear mapping can be normalized and thereby be converted to
117         * a projective mapping (see {@link ProjectiveMapping2D}.
118         * @return the normalized linear mapping (i.e., a projective mapping)
119         */
120        public ProjectiveMapping2D normalize() {
121                if (Arithmetic.isZero(Math.abs(a22))) {
122                        throw new ArithmeticException("Zero value in a22, cannot normalize linear mapping!");
123                }
124                double b00 = a00/a22;   double b01 = a01/a22;   double b02 = a02/a22;
125                double b10 = a10/a22;   double b11 = a11/a22;   double b12 = a12/a22;
126                double b20 = a20/a22;   double b21 = a21/a22;
127                return new ProjectiveMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12, b20, b21);
128        }
129        
130        // ----------------------------------------------------------
131        
132        @Override
133        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
134                final double x = pnt.getX();
135                final double y = pnt.getY();
136                final double h =  (a20 * x + a21 * y + a22);
137                double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02) / h;
138                double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12) / h;
139                return PntDouble.from(x1, y1);
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * Calculates and returns the inverse mapping.
144         */
145        @Override
146        public LinearMapping2D getInverse() {
147                // System.out.println("LinearMapping getInverse()");
148                double[][] ai = Matrix.inverse(this.getTransformationMatrix());
149                return new LinearMapping2D(ai);
150        }
151        
152        /**
153         * Concatenates this mapping A with another linear mapping B and returns
154         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
155         * @param B the second mapping
156         * @return the concatenated mapping
157         */
158        public LinearMapping2D concat(LinearMapping2D B) {
159                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
160                return new LinearMapping2D(C);
161        }
162        
163        /**
164         * Concatenates a sequence of linear mappings AA = (A1, A2, ..., An), with
165         * the result A(x) = A1(A2(...(An(x))...)). Thus, the mapping
166         * An is applied first and A1 last, with the associated transformation
167         * matrix a = a1 * a2 * ... * an.
168         * If AA is empty, the identity mapping is returned.
169         * If AA contains only a single mapping, a copy of this mapping is returned.
170         * 
171         * @param AA a (possibly empty) sequence of linear transformations
172         * @return the concatenated linear transformation 
173         */
174        public static LinearMapping2D concatenate(LinearMapping2D... AA) {
175                if (AA.length == 0) {
176                        return new LinearMapping2D();   // identity
177                }
178                else {
179                        double[][] a = AA[0].getTransformationMatrix();
180                        for (int i = 1; i < AA.length; i++) {
181                                a = Matrix.multiply(a, AA[i].getTransformationMatrix());
182                        }
183                        return new LinearMapping2D(a);
184                }
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Retrieves the transformation matrix for this mapping.
189         * @return the 3x3 transformation matrix
190         */
191        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
192                return new double[][]
193                                {{a00, a01, a02},
194                                 {a10, a11, a12},
195                                 {a20, a21, a22}};
196        }
197
198        /**
199         * Returns a copy of this mapping.
200         * @return a new mapping of the same type
201         */
202        public LinearMapping2D duplicate() {
203                return new LinearMapping2D(this);
204        }
205
206        @Override
207        public String toString() {
208                return Matrix.toString(getTransformationMatrix());
209        }
210        
211        // -----------------------------------------------------------
212

222//                              {-0.307692, 0.230769, 1.000000}};
223//              System.out.println("A = " + Matrix.toString(A));
224//

226//              System.out.println("Ai = " + Matrix.toString(Ai));

229//              System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
230//              
231//              ProjectiveMapping2D pA = (new LinearMapping2D(A)).normalize();
232//              System.out.println("mapping pA = \n" + pA.toString());
233//              
234//              ProjectiveMapping2D AA1 = pA.concat(pA);
235//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA1.toString());
236//              
237//              ProjectiveMapping2D AA2 = LinearMapping2D.concatenate(pA, pA).normalize();
238//              System.out.println("mapping AA1 = \n" + AA2.toString());
239//      }
240
241
242        
243}
244
